728550f-a.text:
Bay Street, adjoining the N.W. corner of Union Place, showing the Vanderbilt House. Commodore Cornelius Vanderbilt spent the years
of his early manhood here.
Ebout 1905
By Eugene G. Putnam.
From Staten IIsland Wuseum Collection.
Through P. L. Sperr.
(2) The same, years later.
February 7, 1920
By William t. Davis through P.L.Sperr.
3) The aite of the Vanderbilt House, viewing east along the north side of Union Place from Beach to Bay Streets, and showing operations for the erection of the Paramount
Buildins.
N.L.Cperr  Tebmuary 10,1930
728550f-a.folder: Bay Street & Union Place, Staten Island, NY

728552f-b.text:
Bay Street, at the N. W. corner of Union Place (left), showing the clearance for the Paramount Buiiding, site of the old Cornelius Vanderbilt House. On the extreme left is the Pape Building, on Union
Place.
February 9, 1930
P. 1. Sperr
(2)
Viewing northwestward across the clearance, from
Union Place.
February 9, 1930
P. L. Sperr
(3)
The Pape Building, on the south side of Union Place, seen across Bay Street and the clearance.
February 9, 1930
P. L. Sperr
728552f-b.folder: Bay Street & Union Place, Staten Island, NY

728551f-b.text:
Bay Street, adioining the N.W. corner of Union Place, showing the Vanderbilt Houss. Eere Commodore Cornelius Vanderbilt spent the years of his early manhood. The maps of 1907 and 1917 show the house to be on property belonging to
Charles Rosenberg.
1924
Views 1,2 and 3
P. L. Sperr
